FT Faculty Headcount:
Overview:
The Fall 2023 Excel file provides Central Connecticut State University’s Faculty & Student Credit Hour, Student Headcount Report. It presents detailed department-level teaching loads, student credit hours, course sections, and enrollment patterns, split between full-time (FT) and part-time (PT) faculty. The report also shows the share of credit hours taught by each group, giving insight into faculty instructional contributions across the university.

Abbreviations Explained:

FT = Full-Time (faculty employed full-time)

PT = Part-Time (faculty employed part-time)

Faculty Headcount = Number of faculty members teaching courses

Student Credit Hr = Total student credit hours taught (measure of instructional workload)

Credit Hr/Faculty = Average number of credit hours taught per faculty member

Student Headcount = Number of students enrolled in courses taught

Student Headcount/Faculty = Average number of students per faculty member

Sections Taught = Number of course sections offered

% Credit Hr by FT Faculty / PT Faculty = Percentage of credit hours taught by full-time versus part-time faculty
